perturbation.original_text:
3.6.1
All payments shall be made by bank transfer to such account as may be indicated by Dexcel, Dexcel and Kitov each bearing
their own bank transfer costs, net thirty (30) days from Delivery. All payments shall be made in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.6.1
All payments shall be made by bank transfer to such account as may be indicated by Dexcel, Dexcel and Kitov each bearing
their own bank transfer costs, net sixty (60) days from Delivery. All payments shall be made in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from net 30 days to net 60 days creates a direct conflict with Section 3.6.2, which specifies actions that Dexcel can take if Kitov is more than twenty-one (21) Working Days late in meeting the payment schedule set forth in Section 3.6.1. This inconsistency leads to uncertainty about the actual payment deadline, and when Dexcel can start charging late fees or delay delivery.

perturbation.original_text:
3.6.2
With the exception of amounts in legitimate dispute, in the event that Kitov is more than twenty one (21) Working Days late
in meeting the payment schedule set forth in Section ​3.6.1, Dexcel may, upon seven (7) Working Days’ written notice to
Kitov (i) delay the delivery of Product ordered until the amounts in arrears are paid, (ii) charge penalties on late payment
with interest at the rate of **** per month from the due date for payment until payment is actually made, and/or (iii) change
or limit the terms of payment for future orders, including requiring the prepayment for new orders or the provision of a letter
of credit by Kitov (at Kitov’s expense) from a bank reasonably acceptable to Dexcel.

perturbation.explanation: Adding the sentence 'Furthermore, Dexcel must grant a grace period of 30 days after the initial 21 working days before enacting any penalties' directly contradicts the original intent of section 3.6.2, which allows Dexcel to take action after just 21 working days of late payment. This introduces uncertainty about when penalties can be applied, as the grace period effectively extends the payment deadline.

10.2
The Parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts of Tel-Aviv in any dispute related to this Agreement without
giving effect to choice of law rules. Notwithstanding the aforesaid, the Parties shall endeavour in good faith to settle amicably any
dispute which may arise between them under or in connection to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.2
The Parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts of Tel-Aviv in any dispute related to this Agreement without
giving effect to choice of law rules. Notwithstanding the aforesaid, the Parties agree that any dispute arising under or in connection with this agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the International Chamber of Commerce.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that disputes will be resolved through binding arbitration directly contradicts the previous sentence establishing exclusive jurisdiction in the courts of Tel-Aviv. This creates a clear inconsistency regarding the dispute resolution mechanism, leaving uncertainty about whether court litigation or arbitration is the appropriate forum for resolving disagreements.
